description-en: A smiling child sits on a cushion, holding the Indian national flag in its left hand. A toy rifle is in his right hand, resting on his thigh and other toys - a tank, a plane and a drum can be seem around him. A partially visible map of India is inscribed on the cushion on which the child sits. (gs/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: In this image, a print difficult to date but bearing the signature of one M. Singa and titled Jhanda Ooncha Rahe Hamaara, “Our Flag Shall Fly Loftily,” one young citizen plays at being soldier surrounded casually by various weapons of mass destruction as if these are benign toys: a tank, a fighter plane, a rifle, and a revolver. He cheerfully waves the national flag and is perched on a cushion on which a partial outline map of India is visible, a hand holding a revolver with its muzzle directed towards the geo-body. Here, as in all the other examples I have shown here, the map of the nation serves as a territorial mnemonic, bringing into view in a manner that is impossible otherwise, the country as a single entity that the citizen is expected to serve with loyalty and devotion to the point of sacrificing oneself in its cause, if necessary by resorting to arms. (Sumathi Ramaswamy) (gs)
